definition: item/component/classifier for events, things, clothes etc

sentences.english: I supervised three other girls and also took care of the company's correspondence.
sentences.chinese: 我督導其他三位女職員，我還負責處理公司的函件。

sentences.english: Our correspondence is limited to a few commercial letters.
sentences.chinese: 我們之間的通信只限於幾封商業函件。

sentences.english: She rephrased the letter to give it more formality.
sentences.chinese: 她修改了函件的措辭，使它更規範一些。

sentences.english: Other urgent messages from one garage to the other.
sentences.chinese: 其他緊急函件，從一個汽車修理部發向另一個。

sentences.english: Put this letter in the main file.
sentences.chinese: 將這函件放入文卷總檔中。

sentences.english: The user has agreed to remove it but cannot remember the log in e. mail address.
sentences.chinese: 用戶已同意將其刪除，但不記得在電子函件地址記錄。

sentences.english: In case of non-delivery, letters must be returned to the senders.
sentences.chinese: 函件無法投遞時務必退還原主。
函件使用了看上去正式的世行信箋。

sentences.english: Formal Note is essentially a formal personal letter.
sentences.chinese: 正式照會實質上是正式的個人函件。

sentences.english: Letters mailing is the core product for Chinese postal enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 函件業務是中國郵政企業的核心產品。

sentences.english: It was evident that at the sight of this document the minister would instantly release him.
sentences.chinese: 據推測，一看到這份函件，大臣會立刻釋放他的。

definition: incoming letter/letter from afar/same as 来信
to issue (a memorandum etc) to lower levels/to distribute (e.g. disaster relief to victims)
to present/to give/to hand over/to hand in/to lay before
